title: Soil Amendment Myths | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Avoid purchasing and using certain garden products in Wyoming.
subtasks: Understand that gypsum is not a general soil conditioner.
Recognize the need to test soil for exchangeable sodium before using gypsum.
Realize that gypsum may not adjust soil pH or lighten clay soils unless sodic.

tasks.task: Avoid using lime in Wyoming gardens.
subtasks: Acknowledge that Wyoming soils are already high in calcium and alkaline.
Recognize that adding lime may not benefit Wyoming garden soils.

tasks.task: Improve soil health through organic matter addition.
subtasks: Consider using compost, mulch, or manure for soil improvement.
Work with local Extension educators for soil testing.
Develop a plan for managing soil health based on test results.
